answers.answer: Have you ask your doctor about this?  Have you had lab work to rule in/out anything?  If you don't have a thyroid or other disorder, you will have to bump up your daily caloric intake until you reach the goal weight.  Good luck.

Hi kalabt0402,Before starting any diet, I think it's important to consult your family doctor.Your family doctor who knows your medical history best, is in the bestposition to give you advice as to how to gain weight safely. Perhaps yourdoctor will want you to have a blood test to see why you're losing weight.I wish you the best of luck. Eve
There are some illnesses that cause weight loss, such as hyperthyroidism and diabetes.  You should ask your doctor to run some simple blood tests to either confirm or rule these out.
Thank you guys. I will definitely do that.

question: I'm 24 years old. I'm 5'9" and I weight 103 lbs. I have a very high metabolism and have always had a problem gaining weight. However, I've been losing weight lately. I'm trying to be on a better diet and eating lots of protein and calories to try and gain some weight. Amy suggestions on good foods, etc for me to be eating? Or any other advice?
title: weight gain
